text: *intro music*
Hey guys, it's Ro welcome to another Nerdy Nummies
I got so many requests from you guys to make something from the movie Moana
so that is exactly what we're going to be doing today
If you haven't noticed, I dressed up as her
I did the I went all out
In the movie it's a tropical setting so there are a ton of coconuts
even when she gets to the water and she's sailing around
she encounters some coconut pirates
So I thought let's make a tropical coconut cupcake
yes
We are going to make a delicious coconut Moana themed cupcake today
let's get started
the things you will need will be
1 cup of all-purpose flour
1/2 a cup of cake flour
1 cup of sugar
1/2 a cup of butter at room temperature
1/2 a cup plus 2 tablespoons of coconut milk
3/4 cup of shredded sweetened coconut
1 egg
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
1 and 1/4 teaspoon of baking powder
and a 1/4 teaspoon of salt
now let's put it all together
the first step is to mix together our dry ingredients
your flour, cake flour, baking powder, and salt
Then whisk together and set it off to the side
now in a larger bowl we will cream our butter and sugar using an electric hand mixer
mix together until it's light and fluffy
Next add vanilla extract and one egg
mix together starting on a low speed and then moving to a higher speed till well combined
our mixtures are ready
now alternate adding your dry ingredients
and your coconut milk to our butter mixture
Add the dry in three parts and the coconut milk in two parts
our batter is almost there the last thing that we mix in is our sweetened shredded coconut
gently fold together
we got this
our batter is ready
time to scoop our cupcakes
I have a cupcake tray lined with a bunch of silicone blue liners
to look like the ocean
now using an ice cream scoop fill each cavity 2/3 full
this recipe makes about 16 to 18 cupcakes depending on how full you make them
our cupcake tray is full it is ready to bake
heat your oven to 350 degrees
and bake for about 14 to 16 minutes
our cupcakes have baked
I've given them plenty of time to cool
I've just got some white buttercream frosting in a piping bag with a large circle tip at the end
frost the top of all of your cupcakes
pipe all the way around
work your way in
then you can use a spatula to smooth it out even more
then frost the rest of your cupcakes
now time to decorate
in a bowl over here I've got the fine shredded toasted coconut
oh this is so fun
take your cupcake face down right into all the coconuts
and gently swirl it around
oh I love this
then do this to the rest of your cupcakes
♪I'm shiny like a [inaudible singing]♪
final decoration step
using red buttercream icing in a piping bag with a #5 tip
we are going to decorate the top
by piping the swirl symbol on Moana's sail
that resembles a wave
I like to start at the bottom of my cupcake
pipe half of the swirl
and then the inverse
then do this to the rest of your cupcakes
ta daaa
here are the Moana themed coconut cupcakes that we made today
if you like coconut as much as I do
you may love this coconut cupcake recipe
it is so good
Imma be posting posting pictures and the recipe on
rosannapansino.com
twitter
instagram
and facebook
so you can check it out there
and if you guys make these treats
please take a picture and send it to me
I love seeing your baking creations
it just makes me happy
it makes my day
if you have any other ideas for any other Nerdy Nummies
please let me know and leave me a comment down below
and I will do my best to make it happen
thanks again you guys
bye bye
ooh and now I get to have one for me
oh my gosh I love coconut
like I have a- *whispers* I have a problem
mmm oh yeah
this is so good
it makes me wanna sing
♪I'm shiny [inaudible singing]♪
oooh I found Maui's fish hook
let's see if this thing works
*magical whoosh*
*magical whoosh*
*outro music*
